content: Danish footballer (born 2002) **Andreas Kristoffer Jungdal** (born 22 February 2002) is a Danish professional [footballer](/wiki/Association_football) who plays as a [goalkeeper](/wiki/Goalkeeper_(association_football)) for [Belgian Pro League](/wiki/Belgian_Pro_League) club [Westerlo](/wiki/K.V.C._Westerlo). Born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), he is a [Denmark](/wiki/Danish_Football_Association) youth international. ## Career Jungdal was born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), where his father was stationed for [The Lego Group](/wiki/The_Lego_Group). His family returned to Denmark, and he started playing football as a five-year-old for Skibet IF in [Vejle](/wiki/Vejle), before joining the town's main club [Vejle Boldklub](/wiki/Vejle_Boldklub) in 2013. On 16 July 2019, Jungdal joined the [youth academy](/wiki/A.C._Milan_Youth_Sector) of Italian [Serie A](/wiki/Serie_A) club [AC Milan](/wiki/A.C._Milan). He was part of the first team for the first time on 26 October 2020 as an unused substitute in a 3–3 home draw against [Roma](/wiki/A.S._Roma) in Serie A. On 18 October 2021, he extended his contract with Milan until 2024. In late 2021, he was sidelined with a disease in his kidneys, but made a full recovery in early 2022. In 10 January 2023, he joined [Austrian Bundesliga](/wiki/Austrian_Football_Bundesliga) club [Rheindorf Altach](/wiki/SC_Rheindorf_Altach) on a six-month loan until the end of the season, with an option to be signed permanently. On 10 August 2023, Jungdal signed with recently relegated [Serie B](/wiki/Serie_B) club [Cremonese](/wiki/U.S._Cremonese), on a free transfer. He made his debut for the club on 31 October, in a 2–1 win against [Cittadella](/wiki/AS_Cittadella) in [Coppa Italia](/wiki/Coppa_Italia). On 16 January 2025, Jungdal moved on loan to [Westerlo](/wiki/K.V.C._Westerlo) in Belgium, with an option to buy. ## Style of play Jungdal has been described as an "explosive" goalkeeper with good ability to play out from the back. The media has compared his playing style to that of [Mike Maignan](/wiki/Mike_Maignan). ## International career Jungdal is eligible to represent the [Singapore national football team](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team) as he was born in Singapore and also eligible to represent Denmark due to both of his parents being from the same country. In 2018, he was called up to the [Denmark U-17 team](/wiki/Denmark_national_under-17_football_team). In May 2025, Jungdal was selected for the [European Championship](/wiki/2025_UEFA_European_Under-21_Championship) with the Danish U21 national team. ## Honours **AC Milan** - [Serie A](/wiki/Serie_A): [2021–22](/wiki/2021%E2%80%9322_Serie_A) - Andreas Jungdal – [UEFA](/wiki/UEFA) competition record (archive) - Andreas Jungdal national team profile at the [Danish Football Association](/wiki/Danish_Football_Association) (in Danish)
title: Andreas Jungdal
